tool.name: Root
tool.description: ferrets out original annotation of a given protein
tool.command:
bin/cpt_root.pl --galaxy --outfile_supporting $__new_file_path__ #if $protein_f and $protein_f is not "None": --protein_f "${protein_f}" #end if
#if $protein_t and $protein_t is not "None": --protein_t "${protein_t}" #end if
--name "${name}"
--results "${results}"
--results_files_path "${results.files_path}"
--results_format "${results_format}"
--results_id "${results.id}"

param.name: protein_f
param.help: Input file containing a single protein sequence
param.label: protein_f

tool.help:
DESCRIPTION ===========
This tool attempts to find the first instance of a protein being annotated as "X", where X is your search query. If you were interested in the first time someone annotated a "Large Terminase" as a "Large Terminase", you would query on that. It is recommended you add an actual terminase sequence so as to identify which annotations are "true" annotations to your protein of interest and not misannotation by other researchers.
